hypothesis_content.title: Pre-Close Gamma Flip Scalp in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes (VIX term structure flat, crypto volatility index < 70), during the 60-90 minutes before the traditional equity market close (3-4 PM ET), if BTC has been range-bound (+/-0.8%) for the prior 4 hours and the spot price approaches a major options strike level (nearest $500 increment) within 0.3%, a swift, scalpable move away from that strike will occur before the equity close, driven by dealer gamma hedging flows rebalancing.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral, range-bound conditions, options dealer gamma positioning becomes a dominant short-term driver. As spot approaches a large strike near equity close, dealers adjust delta hedges, often creating a 'pin' effect or repulsion. This is amplified before the equity close when cross-asset desks reduce overall risk.
entry_conditions: Time between 2:00 PM and 3:30 PM ET
BTC spot price within 0.3% of a major $500 strike (e.g., $88,000)
1-minute RSI(10) is not oversold (<25) or overbought (>75) at approach

exit_conditions.take_profit: 0.5% move away from the strike price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price pushes through the strike by 0.25%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 4:05 PM ET (5 min after equity close)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price consolidates at or slices through the strike level without a swift >0.4% move in more than 35% of observed setups, indicating other flows (e.g., spot accumulation) are overpowering gamma effects.
